tooltip.rotate:
Rotate in the clockwise direction (change azimuth).
Hold down the Ctrl key and press this button for counter-clockwise rotation.
Hold down the Shift key while pressing this button to rotate more slowly.
If a component is selected, rotate around its center. Otherwise rotate everything around the origin.

scope.all_solar_panels_on_foundation: All Solar Panels on this Foundation
footnote.high_shade_tolerance: The energy generated by this panel comes from each cell proportionally (ideal case).
footnote.partial_shade_tolerance: Use bypass diodes to direct current under shading conditions.
footnote.no_shade_tolerance: Shading greatly reduces the output of the entire panel.
footnote.horizontal_single_axis_tracker:
A horizontal single-axis tracker (HSAT) rotates about the north-south axis
to follow the sun from east to west during the day.
footnote.vertical_single_axis_tracker:
A vertical single-axis tracker (VSAT) rotates about the vertical axis
to follow the sun from east to west during the day.
footnote.altazimuth_dual_axis_tracker:
An altazimuth dual-axis tracker rotates about both the horizontal and vertical axes
to follow the sun throughout the day.
tracker.no_tracker_all_on_foundation: No Tracker for All Solar Panels on Selected Foundation
tracker.no_tracker_all: No Tracker for All Solar Panels
msg.pole_height_range: The pole height must be between 0 and 10 meters.
msg.solar_cell_efficiency_range: Solar cell efficiency must be between {0}% and {1}%.
msg.nominal_operating_cell_temperature_r: Nominal Operating Cell Temperature must be between 33 and 58 Celsius degrees.
msg.temperature_coefficient_pmax_range: Temperature coefficient of Pmax must be between -1% and 0% per Celsius degree.
msg.inverter_efficiency_range: Inverter efficiency must be greater than {0}% and less than {1}%.
footnote.solar_cell_efficiency_question: How efficiently can a solar cell convert light into electricity?
footnote.solar_cell_efficiency_details: The Shockley-Queisser limit is 34%. The theoretical limit for multilayer cells is 86%. As of 2017, the best solar panel in the market has an efficiency of 24%. The highest efficiency you can choose is limited to {0}%.
footnote.monocrystalline_description: Solar cells made of monocrystalline silicon are usually round or semi-round. Hence, there is a small fraction of area on a solar panel not covered by cells. In other words, a monocrystalline solar panel has a smaller packing density.
footnote.polycrystalline_description: Solar cells made of polycrystalline silicon are usually square. Compared with a monocrystalline solar panel, a polycrystalline one has a higher packing density. Color has no relationship with efficiency.
footnote.temperature_effects: Increased temperature reduces solar cell efficiency. To determine this temperature effect, it is important to know the expected operating temperature: the Nominal Operating Cell Temperature (NOCT). NOCT ranges from 33°C to 58°C.
footnote.inverter_efficiency: The efficiency of a micro inverter for converting electricity from DC to AC is typically 95%.
footnote.disable_edit_point: Disable the edit point of a solar panel prevents it from being unintentionally moved.
msg.illegal_pole_height_single: This pole height cannot be set as the solar panel would cut into the underlying surface.
msg.illegal_pole_height_row: This pole height cannot be set as one or more solar panels in the row would cut into the underlying surface.
msg.illegal_pole_height_multiple: This pole height cannot be set as one or more solar panels would cut into the underlying surface.
msg.noct_range: Nominal Operating Cell Temperature must be between 33 and 58 Celsius degrees.
msg.temperature_coefficient_range: Temperature coefficient of Pmax must be between -1% and 0% per Celsius degree.

footnote.tilted_single_axis_tracker:
A tilted single-axis tracker (TSAT) rotates about an axis neither parallel nor perpendicular to the ground
and follow the sun from east to west during the day.

footnote.disable_edit_point_heliostat: Disable the edit point of a heliostat prevents it from being unintentionally moved.
footnote.heliostat_target: The sunlight reflected by the mirror(s) of this heliostat will focus on the top of the target tower.
footnote.heliostat_tilt_angle: The tilt angle of the mirror of a heliostat is the angle between its surface and the base surface. The tilt angle must be between -90° and 90°.
footnote.azimuth_angle: The azimuth angle is measured clockwise from the true north.
footnote.reflectance: Reflectance can be affected by pollen and dust.
footnote.aperture_percentage: The percentage of the effective area for reflection after deducting the area of gaps, frames, etc.

msg.system_preferences_info:
System preferences apply to the software.
For setting properties of a model, use
Edit > Properties.
msg.snapshot_logging_disabled: Sorry, the snapshot logging of this file is disabled.
msg.software_up_to_date: Your software is up to date.
msg.software_out_of_date:
Your software is out of date. But for some reason, it cannot update itself.
Please go to http://energy3d.concord.org to download and reinstall the latest version.
msg.no_geolocation: No geolocation is set for this model. It cannot be submitted.
msg.scaling_factor_positive: The scaling factor must be positive.
msg.vsg_legal_notice:
Please be advised that your submission contains an address that may be sensitive,
for example under the circumstance that you are under 18 years old and are working
on a home project. By clicking the Accept Button below, you (and your parent or
guardian if you are a minor) will authorize the Virtual Solar Grid to publish your
work in the public domain. Your work will be a valuable contribution to an important
citizen science project for studying how humanity can be powered by renewable energy.
msg.vsg_authorization: Authorization for the Virtual Solar Grid to publish your work

msg.tilt_angle_range: The tilt angle must be between -90 and 90 degrees.

msg.fixed_tilt_remove_seasonal:
Choosing the fixed tilt angle will remove existing settings for seasonal tilt angles.
Are you sure?
footnote.tilt_angle_rack:
The tilt angle of a rack is the angle between its surface and the ground surface.
The tilt angle must be between -90° and 90°.
footnote.seasonal_tilt_angles:
The tilt angle of a rack is the angle between its surface and the ground surface.
The tilt angle must be between -90° and 90° and may be adjusted seasonally.
footnote.tilt_angle_solar_panel:
The tilt angle of a solar panel is the angle between its surface and the base surface.
The tilt angle must be between -90° and 90°.
footnote.azimuth_angle: The azimuth angle is measured clockwise from the true north.

footnote.shade_tolerance: Use bypass diodes to direct current under shading conditions.
footnote.inverter_efficiency:
The efficiency of a micro inverter for converting electricity
from DC to AC is typically 95%.
footnote.temperature_coefficient_pmax: Increased temperature reduces solar cell efficiency.
footnote.solar_cell_efficiency:
How efficient can a solar panel be for converting light into electricity?
The Shockley-Queisser limit is 34%.
The theoretical limit for multilayer cells is 86%.
As of 2017, the best solar panel in the market has an efficiency of 24%.
The highest efficiency you can choose is limited to {0}%.

msg.vsg_terms:
By pressing the Yes button below, you agree to contribute your work to the Virtual Solar Grid, a public
website that collects many virtual solar power systems. Your work will be reviewed by experts to determine
its readiness for publication. You will be notified about its status through the email you provide above.
If you agree on these terms, please continue. Otherwise, click the No button to abort.
msg.vsg_submit_question: Do you want to submit your work to the Virtual Solar Grid now?
msg.investigation_requires_season: This investigation requires change to a different season.
feedback.mustdo.try_analyzing:
Try analyzing the energy use of the house using the menu
Analysis > Buildings > Dail Energy Analysis for Selected Building...
feedback.mustdo.collect_uvalue_result:
Do you want to collect the U-value of the selected wall and the energy result
following the analysis and type it in the table?
feedback.mustdo.investigate_uvalue:
Your task is to investigate how changing the U-value of a wall affects the energy use of the house.
Right-click a wall and select "Insulation..." from the popup menu to change its U-value. Don't apply
the change to all walls.
feedback.warning.changed_location:
You changed the location. As each location has a different climate,
changing the location may affect the result of energy use.
feedback.warning.changed_date:
You changed the date. As each date has different weather conditions,
changing the date may affect the result of energy use.
feedback.warning.changed_color:
You changed the color of some part of the house. As the color of a house may affect its absorption of solar energy,
changing the color may affect the result of energy use.
feedback.warning.modified_house:
Modification of the house (other than the U-value) is not recommended for this investigation
as it may interfere with the effect of the U-value on energy use.
feedback.warning.changed_uvalue_not_wall:
You changed the U-value of an object that is not a wall.
In this investigation, you should select a wall and change only its U-value.
feedback.warning.adjusted_thermostat:
Adjusting the thermostat is not recommended for this investigation
as it may interfere with the effect of the U-value on energy use.
feedback.warning.changed_all_walls:
You changed the U-values of all walls.
In this investigation, you should select a wall and change only its U-value.
feedback.warning.annual_analysis:
You ran an annual energy analysis.
In this investigation, you should run only daily energy analyses.
feedback.warning.rotation:
Rotation of the house is not recommended for this investigation
as it may interfere with the effect of the U-value on energy use.
feedback.reminder.collect_uvalue_analysi:
Do you want to collect the U-value of the selected wall and the energy result
of the No. {ANALYSIS_NUMBER} analysis and type it in the table?
feedback.progress.only_one_analysis:
You have only run a valid daily energy analysis.
You need to run at least two such analyses.
feedback.progress.two_analyses:
You have run two valid analyses. Did you compare the results to find the relationship
between the difference in energy use and the change of the U-value?
feedback.progress.multiple_analyses:
You have run {COUNT_PATTERN} valid analyses. What relationship between the energy use
of the house and the U-value of the wall did you find?
feedback.question.adjusted_uvalue:
Looks like that you have adjusted the U-value.
Do you want to follow up with an analysis?
